intro: Bisgoeppertia gracilis, commonly known as the slender bisgoeppertia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized flora of the Andean region.
